newsitem.title: USA: Cadence to acquire High Level.
newsitem.headline: Cadence to acquire High Level.

text.p: Cadence Design Systems Inc. said Thursday it will acquire High Level Design Systems Inc., a maker of advanced design technology for integrated circuits, in a stock deal worth about $94.1 million.

Cadence is a major supplier of software and services used to design semiconductors, computer systems, networking and telecommunications equipment, consumer electronics, and a variety of other electronic-based products.

Under the definitive agreement, San Jose, Calif.-based Cadence will offer 0.22 shares of its stock for each High Level Design share in a tax-free swap. Cadence will issue just over 2.55 million common shares and 616,000 employee stock options in the acquistiion, it said.

Cadence rose $1.125 to $38 on the New York Stock Exchange in early afternoon trading. Santa Barbara, Calif.-based High Level Design last traded Wednesday at C$7.25 ($5.35) on Vancouver Stock Exchange in Canada.

"We have a clear vision of where the system-on-a-chip market is headed," Joseph Costello, Cadence chief executive said in a statement. "The only way to deliver a working solution for the unique requirements of this level of design is a combination of the 'best-in-class' technologies from Cadence and High Level Design."
The merger has been approved by the boards of both companies and is subject to approval by the shareholders of High Level Design.
